programme.desc: How did the western United States become a hotspot for unwieldy and devastating forest fires? Learn how the history of forest management and loss of public trust, coupled with climate change, have led to the conditions driving mega-fire.

The USSR began to lose grip on power in Eastern Europe, as the Berlin Wall collapsed. The Chinese Government stamped hard on student protests in Beijing. Plus, an environmental disaster in Alaska and an earthquake shook California.

programme.title: Texas Flood Tragedy: The Aftermath
programme.desc: Four weeks after a catastrophic flood struck Camp Mystic and the surrounding area, Scripps News is back on the ground investigating what went wrong, why warning systems failed and how the community in Central Texas is recovering.

programme.title: 988: In Crisis
programme.desc: "They are calling 9-1-1 and they are in crisis." How one county in Missouri is trying to turn the tide on mental health crises through a new approach in policing.

programme.desc: How did the western United States become a hotspot for unwieldy and devastating forest fires? Learn how the history of forest management and loss of public trust, coupled with climate change, have led to the conditions driving mega-fire.

programme.title: Deception
programme.desc: In Virginia Beach, VA, there is a twisted plot involving murder to try and secure a pay out from the U.S. Navy, while in Grovetown, GA, a mysterious burglar seems to want two women neighbors dead.

programme.title: What Lurks Within
programme.desc: In a suburb of Nashville, TN, a wife's secret lover sets up home in her closet, while in Cave Creek, Arizona, a couple look like they are out for a drive, but only one of them is alive.

programme.title: Operation Cat Walk: Strip Club Sting
programme.desc: FBI agent John Tanza goes undercover targeting the Cleveland mob the best way he can - by running a strip club that they call home. But rival factions place John squarely in the middle of the turf war, and an all-out battle nearly erupts at the club. John enlists a wanna-be security guard to snare everyone involved in the club's illegal operation. But will John's new best friend turn on him when he discovers John is FBI?

programme.title: Operation Mobster
programme.desc: DEA agent Louis Diaz builds a case against New York's most notorious drug mastermind, Nicky Barnes. ATF agent Dominick Polifrone cozies up to a monster serial killer, Richard "Iceman" Kuklinski and nearly becomes a victim. And FBI agent Charlie Maurer makes a deal with the devil to shut down the old school Vegas mob for good.

programme.title: Operation Link Bet: Vegas Mob Bust
programme.desc: FBI agent John Ligato is on a mission to drive a stake into the heart of the Vegas mob. To do this, he cozies up to a mafia boss who has his hands in organized crime. John infiltrates a mob trucking heist ring and gets a price put on his head in the process. But can John dodge the bill collector and hitman long enough for the FBI to arrest everyone he's got evidence on?

programme.title: Operation Big Easy: New Orleans Mob
programme.desc: FBI agent Geoff Santini goes undercover to snag a drug-dealing killer. Geoff endures weeks of dinners and business meetings while the dealer decides if he's dealing with a cop, or the real deal. When the big coke sale finally goes down, a cartel hit team nearly gets Geoff killed. Can the agent take the drug dealers down before he's made as a cop and loses his life?

programme.title: Operation Cat Walk: Strip Club Sting
programme.desc: FBI agent John Tanza goes undercover targeting the Cleveland mob the best way he can - by running a strip club that they call home. But rival factions place John squarely in the middle of the turf war, and an all-out battle nearly erupts at the club. John enlists a wanna-be security guard to snare everyone involved in the club's illegal operation. But will John's new best friend turn on him when he discovers John is FBI?

And FBI agent Charlie Maurer makes a deal with the devil to shut down the old school Vegas mob for good.

programme.title: Operation Link Bet: Vegas Mob Bust

John infiltrates a mob trucking heist ring and gets a price put on his head in the process. But can John dodge the bill collector and hitman long enough for the FBI to arrest everyone he's got evidence on?

programme.title: Operation Big Easy: New Orleans Mob
programme.desc: FBI agent Geoff Santini goes undercover to snag a drug-dealing killer. Geoff endures weeks of dinners and business meetings while the dealer decides if he's dealing with a cop, or the real deal. programme.title: Siberian Tiger
programme.desc: This episode features a variety of animals found on land, and in the sea. Find out how the badger is able to dig tunnels up to 13 feet deep. And why the Siberian tiger is the largest cat in the world.

programme.title: Animals that Amaze
programme.desc: This episode features a variety of animals found on land, and in the sea. Find out why spider silk is 5 times stronger than steel. And how the vulture is able to digest some of the world's most deadly bacteria.

programme.title: Forest
programme.desc: Host Philippe Cousteau looks at ways scientists are measuring the health of our forests. In New England, Philippe visits a white pine forest that is being threatened by invasive plants. At the University of California - Santa Cruz, students use sonic-tomography to look inside trees in order to detect any signs of disease. At the Pine Barrens of New Jersey, we discover why the pitch pine tree is able to withstand occasional wildfires. And in Los Angeles, volunteers are planting trees in order to create an urban forest.

programme.title: Food
programme.desc: Host Philippe Cousteau looks at new ways of cultivating fresh, nutritious food. He visits a farm in Los Angeles where they grow food on a parking lot, just to show that fresh food can be grown in an urban environment. We also look into what distinguishes fruits from vegetables. The results can be surprising. And then we look at the amount of food that is wasted worldwide, and why so many people go hungry every night.

programme.title: Operation Mobster
programme.desc: DEA agent Louis Diaz builds a case against New York's most notorious drug mastermind, Nicky Barnes. ATF agent Dominick Polifrone cozies up to a monster serial killer, Richard "Iceman" Kuklinski and nearly becomes a victim. And FBI agent Charlie Maurer makes a deal with the devil to shut down the old school Vegas mob for good.

programme.title: Operation Link Bet: Vegas Mob Bust
programme.desc: FBI agent John Ligato is on a mission to drive a stake into the heart of the Vegas mob. To do this, he cozies up to a mafia boss who has his hands in organized crime. John infiltrates a mob trucking heist ring and gets a price put on his head in the process. But can John dodge the bill collector and hitman long enough for the FBI to arrest everyone he's got evidence on?

programme.title: Operation Big Easy: New Orleans Mob
programme.desc: FBI agent Geoff Santini goes undercover to snag a drug-dealing killer. Geoff endures weeks of dinners and business meetings while the dealer decides if he's dealing with a cop, or the real deal. When the big coke sale finally goes down, a cartel hit team nearly gets Geoff killed. Can the agent take the drug dealers down before he's made as a cop and loses his life?

programme.title: Siberian Tiger
programme.desc: This episode features a variety of animals found on land, and in the sea. Find out how the badger is able to dig tunnels up to 13 feet deep. And why the Siberian tiger is the largest cat in the world.

programme.title: Animals that Amaze
programme.desc: This episode features a variety of animals found on land, and in the sea. Find out why spider silk is 5 times stronger than steel. And how the vulture is able to digest some of the world's most deadly bacteria.

programme.title: Forest
programme.desc: Host Philippe Cousteau looks at ways scientists are measuring the health of our forests. In New England, Philippe visits a white pine forest that is being threatened by invasive plants. At the University of California - Santa Cruz, students use sonic-tomography to look inside trees in order to detect any signs of disease. At the Pine Barrens of New Jersey, we discover why the pitch pine tree is able to withstand occasional wildfires. And in Los Angeles, volunteers are planting trees in order to create an urban forest.

programme.title: Food
programme.desc: Host Philippe Cousteau looks at new ways of cultivating fresh, nutritious food. He visits a farm in Los Angeles where they grow food on a parking lot, just to show that fresh food can be grown in an urban environment. We also look into what distinguishes fruits from vegetables. The results can be surprising. And then we look at the amount of food that is wasted worldwide, and why so many people go hungry every night.

programme.desc: Join former USA TODAY columnist Jefferson Graham as he brings viewers to the planet's most photographable places, takes them on a virtual photowalk and offers tips on getting great vacation photos with your phone.

programme.title: Ketamine: From Street Drug To Lifesaver
programme.desc: Suicide is the 2nd leading cause of death in the world for those aged 15-24 years. Now, there may be a new tool in fighting depression. It's the 50-year-old anesthetic, Ketamine.

programme.title: Operation Cat Walk: Strip Club Sting
programme.desc: FBI agent John Tanza goes undercover targeting the Cleveland mob the best way he can - by running a strip club that they call home. But rival factions place John squarely in the middle of the turf war, and an all-out battle nearly erupts at the club. John enlists a wanna-be security guard to snare everyone involved in the club's illegal operation. But will John's new best friend turn on him when he discovers John is FBI?
